intro: Corydalis jingyuanensis, commonly known as the Jingyuan Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and clusters of small, delicate flowers. The plant typically blooms in spring, producing pink to purple flowers that are attractive to pollinators. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested or mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
